thread.title: Coronation Street spoiler: Bethany Platt to give paedophile Nathan Curtis an ALIBI after he's arrested for abduction?

title: Coronation Street spoiler: Bethany Platt to give paedophile Nathan Curtis an ALIBI after he's arrested for abduction?

organizations.name: facebook follow us on twitter soaps newsletter follow @mirrortv subscribe

text:
Coronation Street spoiler: Bethany Platt to give paedophile Nathan Curtis an ALIBI after he's arrested for abduction? Bethany is falling harder and harder for the newcomer after he's been grooming her Share Comments By Hayley Minn 12:47, 14 FEB 2017 Updated 12:52, 14 FEB 2017 TV Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in Corrie's Nathan gets arrested for abducting young girl Share this video Watch Next Share Comments Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Coronation Street viewers have been very worried for Bethany Platt recently, as she’s falling harder and harder for creepy Nathan Curtis.
And, rightly so, as the ITV soap newcomer gets arrested for abduction in tomorrow’s episode.
In a clip played on This Morning, police turn up and place him under arrest for abducting Annabel Adams on 15th December 2016.
And Bethany looks shocked as it happens, with him insisting it must be “a mistake”.
But, Sharon Marshall said it’s very likely Bethany will end up giving him an alibi.
Read More Coronation Street star reveals he met with sex abuse victims to research role as child groomer Bethany will see Nathan get arrested for abduction (Photo: ITV) Will she give him an alibi? (Photo: ITV) Will Bethany be prepared to lie to the police?
And, if Nathan does find himself off the hook, is he lining up Bethany to be his next victim?
Newcomer Chris Harper - who plays Nathan - is going to lure unsuspecting schoolgirl Bethany to bed this week – then set about grooming her for sex parties with other perverts.
But in reality, Chris is hoping his sinister storyline will help more terrified victims of paedophiles to come forward, as revealed by the Sunday People.
Read More 'How does Shona know Kylie Platt?' Coronation Street viewers confused as she visits murdered character's grave He's been grooming her! (Photo: ITV) The 39-year-old actor prepared for the role by meeting abuse survivors through the NSPCC. And the shattering impact their stories had on him has only increased his determination to play the pervert to perfection.
“Nothing can desensitise you to what survivors of sexual exploitation have gone through. It’s the most important storyline I’ve ever had,” says Chris in our interview on the soap’s set.
*Coronation Street continues on ITV1 tomorrow at 7.30pm
*This Morning continues on ITV1 weekdays at 10.30am
